intro: Dipladenia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, orange to red blooms that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Dipladenia boliviensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
